item.title: Hacker News Top Stories: Thursday, May 1, 2025 at 10:20 AM UTC
item.description:
1. 108B Pixel Scan of Johannes Vermeer's Girl with a Pearl Earring (245 points | 73 comments)
2. Mercury: Commercial-scale diffusion language model (326 points | 134 comments)
3. Office is too slow, so Microsoft is making it load at Windows startup (174 points | 240 comments)
4. Apple violated antitrust ruling, judge finds (742 points | 277 comments)
5. Pwning the Ladybird Browser (190 points | 24 comments)
6. Espressif's ESP32-C5 Is Now in Mass Production (185 points | 123 comments)
7. How the US defense secretary circumvents official DoD communications equipment (198 points | 159 comments)
8. Microsoft gets twitchy over talk of Europe's tech independence (27 points | 4 comments)
9. All four major web browsers are about to lose 80% of their funding (332 points | 319 comments)
10. Linux Kernel Exploitation: Attack of the Vsock (195 points | 51 comments)
11. Zhaoxin's KX-7000 (149 points | 36 comments)

13. A competing theory to 'dark energy' suggests universe has different time zones (37 points | 16 comments)
14. I created Perfect Wiki and reached $250k in annual revenue without investors (636 points | 357 comments)
15. Someone at YouTube needs glasses (1186 points | 624 comments)
16. Reversible computing with mechanical links and pivots (143 points | 64 comments)

20. Company built its own rail terminal in NYC to avoid relying on trucks (94 points | 20 comments)
21. Future of OSU Open Source Lab in Jeopardy (235 points | 77 comments)
22. GroMo (YC W21) Is Hiring ( | hide)
23. You Wouldn't Download a Hacker News (409 points | 215 comments)
24. Stockhausen: Sounds in Space (24 points | 3 comments)
25. Home washing machines fail to remove important pathogens from textiles (43 points | 60 comments)
26. The True Size Of (258 points | 119 comments)
27. Julia Parsons, U.S. Navy Code Breaker During World War II, Dies at 104 (132 points | 9 comments)
28. Show HN: Convert Large CSV/XLSX to JSON or XML in Browser (25 points | 8 comments)
29. Show HN: ART – a new open-source RL framework for training agents (92 points | 11 comments)
30. DeepSeek-Prover-V2 (357 points | 73 comments)
